Crimes.Legal_Issue: Procedural fairness, application of legal test, reasonableness of decision
Crimes.Application_Facts: Applicants overstayed visas after failed refugee claims; sought humanitarian and compassionate grounds to remain
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Judicial review to overturn refusal and allow stay in Canada
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Officer assessed application based on updated country conditions and hardship factors
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged procedural unfairness, bias, incorrect legal test
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Hardship, risk, establishment in Canada, country conditions
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Alleged lack of opportunity to update information, use of extrinsic evidence
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Submissions on personal circumstances and hardship
Crimes.Relief_Sought: Permission to remain in Canada on H&C grounds
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Administrative decision must be fair, lawful, and reasonable
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: Insufficient evidence of unusual or disproportionate hardship
Crimes.Outcome: Application dismissed; applicants not permitted to stay
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Officer found no unusual or disproportionate hardship
Crimes.Cause_Description: Applicants overstayed visas and sought H&C relief after failed refugee claims
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Officer considered all relevant information including updated reports
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Violated: None directly cited; non-compliance with stay conditions implied
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: No major disputes over authenticity or admissibility
Crimes.Residency_Compliance: Non-compliant due to overstaying authorized period
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Issue: Federal Court jurisdiction over immigration decisions
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: No exceptional hardship demonstrated; decision reasonable
Crimes.Legal_Standard_Applied: Unusual, undeserved, or disproportionate hardship under s.25(1)

Crimes.Dispute_Type: Immigration status and humanitarian application refusal
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Fairness, bias, legality, and reasonableness of refusal decision
Crimes.Procedural_Context: Post-refugee claim humanitarian and compassionate application
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Documentary evidence, personal submissions, country reports
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Request to remain on humanitarian and compassionate grounds
Crimes.Evaluation_Standard: Reasonableness standard applied to administrative decision
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Lack of sufficient evidence of hardship
Crimes.Application_Error: Alleged misapplication of legal test and procedural unfairness
Crimes.Evidence_Ignored: Claimed by applicants, but not accepted by court
Crimes.Application_Factor: Establishment in Canada, family ties, hardship upon removal
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Procedural fairness, correctness of legal test, reasonableness
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Applicants failed to provide compelling evidence of hardship
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge based on procedural fairness and legal error
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Focus: Canadian immigration law and administrative law
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Alleged denial of opportunity to respond to evidence
Crimes.Omission_Type: Failure to update information prior to decision
